{"step_by_step_thinking": "Focal sclerosing osteomyelitis, also known as condensing osteitis, is a type of osteomyelitis that is characterized by the formation of dense bone. It is not due to excessive periosteal bone formation, but rather due to a reaction to low-grade infection, often dental in origin. It is not typically extremely painful, and it is not a common sequel following sequestrectomy.", "answer_choice": "C"}
